bugs.title: CVE-2018-6353 electrum: Python console not sandboxed in Electrum

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2018-6353 electrum: Python console not sandboxed in Electrum

long_desc.thetext:
The Python console in Electrum through 2.9.4 and 3.x through 3.0.5 supports arbitrary Python code without considering (1) social-engineering attacks in which a user pastes code that they do not understand and (2) code pasted by a physically proximate attacker at an unattended workstation, which makes it easier for attackers to steal Bitcoin via hook code that runs at a later time when the wallet password has been entered, a different vulnerability than CVE-2018-1000022.

Upstream bug:

https://github.com/spesmilo/electrum/issues/3678

Upstream bug:

https://github.com/spesmilo/electrum/pull/3700

Created electrum tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 1539917]
Electrum 3.0.6 that have a fix for this issue have been pushed to stable.

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2018-6353 electrum: Python console not sandboxed in Electrum

long_desc.thetext:
The Python console in Electrum through 2.9.4 and 3.x through 3.0.5 supports arbitrary Python code without considering (1) social-engineering attacks in which a user pastes code that they do not understand and (2) code pasted by a physically proximate attacker at an unattended workstation, which makes it easier for attackers to steal Bitcoin via hook code that runs at a later time when the wallet password has been entered, a different vulnerability than CVE-2018-1000022.

Upstream bug:

https://github.com/spesmilo/electrum/issues/3678

Upstream bug:

https://github.com/spesmilo/electrum/pull/3700

Created electrum tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 1539917]
Electrum 3.0.6 that have a fix for this issue have been pushed to stable.

This is an automatically created tracking bug!  It was created to ensure
that one or more security vulnerabilities are fixed in affected versions
of fedora-all.

For comments that are specific to the vulnerability please use bugs filed
against the "Security Response" product referenced in the "Blocks" field.

For more information see:
http://fedoraproject.org/wiki/Security/TrackingBugs

When submitting as an update, use the fedpkg template provided in the next
comment(s).  This will include the bug IDs of this tracking bug as well as
the relevant top-level CVE bugs.

Please also mention the CVE IDs being fixed in the RPM changelog and the
fedpkg commit message.

NOTE: this issue affects multiple supported versions of Fedora. While only
one tracking bug has been filed, please correct all affected versions at
the same time.  If you need to fix the versions independent of each other,
you may clone this bug as appropriate.

Use the following template to for the 'fedpkg update' request to submit an
update for this issue as it contains the top-level parent bug(s) as well as
this tracking bug.  This will ensure that all associated bugs get updated
when new packages are pushed to stable.

=====

# bugfix, security, enhancement, newpackage (required)
type=security

# testing, stable
request=testing

# Bug numbers: 1234,9876
bugs=1539916,1539917

# Description of your update
notes=Security fix for [PUT CVEs HERE]

# Enable request automation based on the stable/unstable karma thresholds
autokarma=True
stable_karma=3
unstable_karma=-3

# Automatically close bugs when this marked as stable
close_bugs=True

# Suggest that users restart after update
suggest_reboot=False

======

Additionally, you may opt to use the bodhi web interface to submit updates:

https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/new

bugs.title: Electrum is not up to date - 3.0.6 is newest, 3.0.5 is maintained

bugzilla.short_desc: Electrum is not up to date - 3.0.6 is newest, 3.0.5 is maintained

long_desc.thetext:
Description of problem:

electrum is not up to date - 3.0.6 is the newest, 3.0.5 is maintained

https://electrum.org/

Version-Release number of selected component (if applicable):3.0.5

I updated the spec an srpm here: 

Spec URL: http://copr-be.cloud.fedoraproject.org/results/caravel/electrum/fedora-rawhide-x86_64/00717131-electrum/electrum.spec

SRPM URL: http://copr-be.cloud.fedoraproject.org/results/caravel/electrum/fedora-rawhide-x86_64/00717131-electrum/electrum-3.0.6-1.fc28.src.rpm

@Jonny: Could you please respond, whether you can update this? 

If you add me to the list of maintainers, I can also do the update.
I will push one update now, what is your FAS user name?
electrum-3.0.6-1.fc27 has been submitted as an update to Fedora 27. https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2018-4edbabf88a

Thanks. 

My FAS user name is: caravel

electrum-3.0.6-1.fc27 has been pushed to the Fedora 27 testing repository. If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.
See https://fedoraproject.org/wiki/QA:Updates_Testing for
instructions on how to install test updates.
You can provide feedback for this update here: https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2018-4edbabf88a

(In reply to arrarexcaravels from comment #5)
> Thanks. 
> 
> My FAS user name is: caravel

Are you a packager? I could not see any packages you maintain.
I am not a packer yet, but would like to become one. This would be my first package.

(In reply to arrarexcaravels from comment #8)
> I am not a packer yet, but would like to become one. This would be my first
> package.

Great, I would follow this guide: https://fedoraproject.org/wiki/Join_the_package_collection_maintainers

TL;DR: Make some new packages that does not exists in Fedora, submit them for review and find a sponsor.
electrum-3.0.6-1.fc27 has been pushed to the Fedora 27 stable repository. If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.
